comments.text: "The President's never wrong." What an obedient little slave.﻿
comments.author: Liberal Prolifer

comments.text:
What with all these GOP-trumped-up scandals geared to thwart Obama 
governance the one real scandal still lingers, ignored and seemingly 
forgotten. Just what were Bush/Cheney doing on the Bush ranch when they got 
intelligence reports that al qaeda was going to attack the US in the summer 
of 2001? It was a huge intelligence failure. It was on Bush/Cheney´s watch 
that the biggest domestic attack in US history happened, of which the 
catastrophic are still being felt ... the 30% increase in gov´t ($4 
trillion for Homeland Security alone and counting), two unnecessary wars 
(another $4 trillion and counting), and the huge cost in blood and guts. 
This is the scandal that warrants investigation.﻿

comments.author: Shane Ebertowski (shanee)

comments.text:
When Reagan took office the deficit was 1 trillion dollars. I'm not sure 
but, I think it tripled when he left. Mostly, due to the tax changes and 
corporate welfare. He, also gave us arms for hostages, Grenada, Nicaragua, 
El Salvador, an increase in the war on drugs (almost to point of 
demonization), and several other stupid and scary things. Republican 
presidents have continued his legacy of wars, corporate welfare and robbing 
from the middle-class and poor to help the rich and catastrophic increases 
in the deficit. Then, Bush took Clinton's surplus and almost doubled the 
deficit. Besides, 9/11(I'm talking about laughable lack of urgency on 9/11 
as well as the memo), the war in Iraq (both the run up and the war itself, 
which was unnecessary). A lot soldiers died because we were unprepared for 
the deployment. There were no bid contracts to Haliburton(surprise, Cheney) 
and others. Afghanistan(Osama) was underfunded, equipped, and manned. In 
short, one big mess! ﻿

comments.author: Johnny Sokko

comments.text:
I don't listen to Hannity no more, cos he sounds like a broken record. All 
he did when Bush was president was, bitch, bitch, bitch. Now all he's done 
with Obama as president is, bitch, bitch, bitch. So it appears as if no 
matter WHO is president, all Hannity is gonna do is bitch about it. And 
therefore sound like a broken record. In short, he's a blooming idiot. As 
for what Jesse said, while its true that Obama inherited Bush's mess, "IF" 
Jesse ever becomes president, all he'll do is, inherit Obama's mess. And 
this'll just go on & on & on. No way, no matter WHO the president is, will 
be able in 4 or even 8 years if they get re-elected will be able to fix 
this country. Its gonna take more than 4 to 8 years to pull that one off. 
I'm reminded of what Ben Jones once said. You may know him as Cooter the 
mechanic on the show Dukes Of Hazzard. What you might NOT know is, he was 
once in Washington. After his time there, I saw em on TV & he said, & I 
have to agree with him cos he makes sense when he said this, he said, 
"There's no "quick" fix to our country's problems. You cant just wave an 
umbrella over it or a magic wand over it & say "Poof" its fixed. It took 
YEARS to get it this way, & it'll take YEARS to fix it. In short, there's 
no "Quick" fix to it."  And like it or not, he is SO RIGHT on all accounts. 
Now the next president might make things a little better or allot worse, 
but on the better side, its not gonna get ALLOT better. Not in no 4 to 8 
years it won't. Just look at how many years its taken, for this country to 
get in the shape its in now. And believe you me, its taken way more than 8 
years to get there. So Cooter is 100% RIGHT. ﻿

comments.text:
+frankos rooni By the way, even when someone does report something 
accurately, you can't even read an article correctly and then pass on what 
it actually says.  As everyone knows that both Iran and the U.S. are 
fighting ISIS and that ISIS is a common enemy for DIFFERENT reasons.  The 
U.S. is not, however, FUNDING Iranian troops.  You definitely have issues 
as you waste all this time talking about Fox News making things up and then 
you say things which are totally absurd.   

As the UK Business Insider article you reference actually says that the 
U.S. may be consciously or inadvertently taking part in Iran's plans in 
Iraq.  Do you know what the word 'MAY' means?  It does not mean 
'DEFINITIVE.'  You've made a total fool of yourself and there's not one 
intellectually honest argument you can now put forth to undo that fact.
comments.author: Christopher Tyler

comments.text:
I'm glad you answered the questions and thanks.  Because as to the first 
question, regarding Iran, whatever news station or stations you watch 
obviously do not provide you with the proper information.  As we have no 
idea as to what the deal the overall specifics of the deal are, and thus, 
there is no way you can intelligently make a decision as to whether or not 
it is something we should support.  And as to a few things which have 
leaked out, the U.S. says it means one thing, while the Iranians say it 
means something altogether different.  So obviously, you appear to take the 
Nancy Pelosi approach to things as you obviously think it's WISE to find 
out about something, ONLY AFTER THE DEAL IS DONE, and then we can read it.  
You realize, of course, that this is precisely happened with Obamacare, as 
very few people knew what was truly in it and many of the things President 
Obama said were or would not happen were shown to be demonstrably false.  
Or didn't the BBC tell you that?  lol

 Also, I'm glad to see that at least you got part of the second question 
correct inasmuch as you referenced Bill Clinton's role.  Also, I have 
criticized President Bush on many issues, but as to the banks and very poor 
or lacking regulations, which is the major reason for the economic 
collapse, whatever news outlet you watched obviously did not give you the 
right information as to that either.  Because notice how you tie in Bush 
with the banks and the GSEs (the Government Sponsored Entities - Fannie Mae 
and Freddie Mac) even though George Bush, several years before the housing 
market bubble, was sounding the alarm as to the need for the regulations 
that you speak of.  And, both the White House and Republicans in Congress 
continuously put forth efforts to put in place the needed 
legislation/regulation that would have averted the crisis.  The Democrats, 
however, who usually are very big on regulations, were absolutely opposed 
to the needed regulations wanted by both Bush and the GOP.  Moreover, then 
Senator Obama was very much on record saying that he would be glad to 
filibuster any Republican attempts to put in place those regulations if 
they could get them to the Senate floor.  And, I can very easily come back 
with the names of the legislation and the specifics, while I can post the 
videos of the congressional hearings in which the democrats were so unified 
in being against Bush and the GOP on this particular issue.  So how is it 
that an individual like yourself, who watches such trustworthy new's 
sources got the overall answer to both of these questions wrong?  Well, the 
answer is rather clear, as only a total partisan would be in support of a 
deal with Iran when no one in the media has any idea as to the real 
hardcore specifics.  And, you wouldn't know about Bush and the GOP fighting 
for those regulations to stop the housing crisis because the left wing 
media would be the ones to either not report the information in a timely 
manner or under report the story.  So don't go talking to me about not 
knowing anything about economics, like a smart ass, as you have no idea 
what you are talking about.  And yes, the joke has gone too far, as it's on 
inasmuch as you're lack of knowledge is STUNNING.    While, the truth is,  
the GOP and the DEMOCRATS both have good and bad ideas.  But as to the 
housing crisis, and the regulations that were needed, that I am SO, SO 
GLAD you brought up, Bush and the GOP were in the right place at the right 
time as to that issue.  You've lost hands down and it's rather amusing 
given your smugness and how you like to lead others to believe that you 
actually know what you're talking about;-)
comments.author: Christopher Tyler

comments.text:
+Christopher Tyler Yes Fox news told us that the UK was turning into a 
muslim state and that Birmingham was under sharia law.
They had to apologise for this nonsense --but a decent news organisation 
shouldn't get itself into this situation in the first place
Who are their editors --did they really think this crap was real?

Sorry --this is not a legitimate news station but a partisan arm of the GOP.
Ridiculous
Iran must be dealt with --so the deal is appropriate
The reality is that it has a large number of doves in the ruling party who 
want a deal with the US --and have NO interest in funding a nuclear weapon 
of any description
http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/apr/06/barack-obama-fights-back-against-israeli-critics-of-iran-nuclear-deal
The US is also using Iranian troops--and funding them  to fight its latest 
enemy --so it seems appropriate
http://uk.businessinsider.com/us-and-iran-working-together-in-iraq-2015-4?r=US
So what is your point --that the attack dog mentality of nuke them all Fox 
is correct?
Do me a favour

If you think the answer to the economic collapse question is easy you know 
nothing about economics --it is a combination of pernicious NINJA loans, 
Clinton interference in the mortgage market --later carried on by Bush , 
bad loans wrapped up in inapproprite packaging , and banks with very poor 
regulation .
The total collapse ofthe market followed due to a sense of assets being 
devalued
In the UK the lack of correct pressure testing by the FSA which replaced 
the BOE didn't help either
Does that help you?
Did Fox blame Bush or the banks in any way for this?
Probably not

The rest of the world is laughing at Fox and its partisan owner 
Murdoch--the same man who ran News of the World --another journalistic 
disaster zone
http://www.theguardian.com/media/2011/jul/07/news-of-the-world-rupert-murdoch
Face it the joke has gone too far
comments.author: frankos rooni

comments.text:
+frankos rooni Neither I nor Fox cares if left wing liberals consider them 
a joke.  And if I had a dime for every time I hear about the BBC and PBS, 
I'd be a rich, rich man.  While PBS is quite left wing and I don't watch 
the BBC enough to know.  There is also a difference between straight news, 
which Fox does as well as anyone, and then opinion, commentary and 
entertainment.  And Fox is quite good at the latter, too, as it's part of 
the reason they have such high ratings.  O'Reilley and Hannity are not 
STRAIGHT news men.  Their shows offer their opinions and their shows, too, 
also offer the opinions of those on the left.  So what is wrong with that?  
I know they cut people off, sometimes, as that is just their style.  It 
also, sometimes, makes for good TV.  And no, they don't always cut them off 
because they are losing a debate.  I've seen O'Reilley when he has been 
right and wrong.  And a good deal of the time when he interrupts it's 
because the other person has gone off on a tangent and won't give him a 
straight answer.  Let's do this and see how intellectually honest you are.  
(1)  Do you support or are you against the deal with Iran? and (2) What was 
the major for our economic collapse prior to President Obama coming into 
office?  If the news shows you watch give the facts in a clear, 
non-partisan way, I am quite sure you will give the answers to what are 
rather easy questions.
comments.author: Christopher Tyler

comments.text:

comments.author: frankos rooni

comments.text:
+frankos rooni Bill O'Reilley is obviously smarter than the average person 
and he is not a straight news man and there is a difference.  Also, if you 
watch his show, after he gives his talking points memo, he always turns to 
a liberal democrat first and asks them to then tell the audience where he 
went wrong. So in the overall presentation, how can that be considered more 
biased than the Young Turks, who are in this link, and hardly ever have 
anyone from the other side to offer rebuttal?  I know you don't like Fox, 
but they actually do have a lot of liberal democrats on to make sure that 
when a person watches they come away having heard both sides of an argument 
and can then make their own decision.  It's true that their commentators 
are conservative, but what I said as to putting forth the other side just 
can not be denied.
